verses.roman:
yāvat tapaty asau gobhir
yāvad induḥ sahoḍubhiḥ
yāvad varṣati parjanyas
tāvatī bhūr iyaṁ tava

synonyms: yāvat—as far as; tapati—is shining; asau—the sun; gobhiḥ—by the sunshine; yāvat—as long or as far as; induḥ—the moon; saha-uḍubhiḥ—with the luminaries or stars; yāvat—as far as; varṣati—are pouring rain; parjanyaḥ—the clouds; tāvatī—to that much distance; bhūḥ—land; iyam—this; tava—in your possession.
translation: As far as the sun and moon shine with the stars and as far as the clouds pour rain, all the land throughout the universe is in your possession.
